fluff.name: Barbarian
entries: A tall human tribesman strides through a blizzard, draped in fur and hefting his axe. He laughs as he charges toward the frost giant who dared poach his people's elk herd.
A half-orc snarls at the latest challenger to her authority over their savage tribe, ready to break his neck with her bare hands as she did to the last six rivals.
Frothing at the mouth, a dwarf slams his helmet into the face of his drow foe, then turns to drive his armored elbow into the gut of another.

These barbarians, different as they might be, are defined by their rage: unbridled, unquenchable, and unthinking fury. More than a mere emotion, their anger is the ferocity of a cornered predator, the unrelenting assault of a storm, the churning turmoil of the sea.

For some, their rage springs from a communion with fierce animal spirits. Others draw from a roiling reservoir of anger at a world full of pain. For every barbarian, rage is a power that fuels not just a battle frenzy but also uncanny reflexes, resilience, and feats of strength.

entries.name: Primal Instinct
entries: People of towns and cities take pride in how their civilized ways set them apart from animals, as if denying one's own nature was a mark of superiority. To a barbarian, though, civilization is no virtue, but a sign of weakness. The strong embrace their animal nature—keen instincts, primal physicality, and ferocious rage. Barbarians are uncomfortable when hedged in by walls and crowds. They thrive in the wilds of their homelands: the tundra, jungle, or grasslands where their tribes live and hunt.

Barbarians come alive in the chaos of combat. They can enter a berserk state where rage takes over, giving them superhuman strength and resilience. A barbarian can draw on this reservoir of fury only a few times without resting, but those few rages are usually sufficient to defeat whatever threats arise.

entries.name: A Life of Danger
entries: Not every member of the tribes deemed "barbarians" by scions of civilized society has the barbarian class. A true barbarian among these people is as uncommon as a skilled fighter in a town, and he or she plays a similar role as a protector of the people and a leader in times of war. Life in the wild places of the world is fraught with peril: rival tribes, deadly weather, and terrifying monsters. Barbarians charge headlong into that danger so that their people don't have to.

Their courage in the face of danger makes barbarians perfectly suited for adventuring. Wandering is often a way of life for their native tribes, and the rootless life of the adventurer is little hardship for a barbarian. Some barbarians miss the close-knit family structures of the tribe, but eventually find them replaced by the bonds formed among the members of their adventuring parties.

entries.name: Creating a Barbarian
entries: When creating a barbarian character, think about where your character comes from and his or her place in the world. Talk with your DM about an appropriate origin for your barbarian. Did you come from a distant land, making you a stranger in the area of the campaign? Or is the campaign set in a rough-and-tumble frontier where barbarians are common?

What led you to take up the adventuring life? Were you lured to settled lands by the promise of riches? Did you join forces with soldiers of those lands to face a shared threat? Did monsters or an invading horde drive you out of your homeland, making you a rootless refugee? Perhaps you were a prisoner of war, brought in chains to "civilized" lands and only now able to win your freedom. Or you might have been cast out from your people because of a crime you committed, a taboo you violated, or a coup that removed you from a position of authority.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a barbarian quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Strength, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the {@background outlander} background.
I have witnessed the indomitable performance of barbarians on the field of battle, and it makes me wonder what force lies at the heart of their rage.

The anger felt by a normal person resembles the rage of a barbarian in the same way that a gentle breeze is akin to a furious thunderstorm. The barbarian's driving force comes from a place that transcends mere emotion, making its manifestation all the more terrible. Whether the impetus for the fury comes entirely from within or from forging a link with a spirit animal, a raging barbarian becomes able to perform supernatural feats of strength and endurance. The outburst is temporary, but while it lasts, it takes over body and mind, driving the barbarian on despite peril and injury, until the last enemy falls.

It can be tempting to play a barbarian character that is a straightforward application of the classic archetype—a brute, and usually a dimwitted one at that, who rushes in where others fear to tread. But not all the barbarians in the world are cut from that cloth, so you can certainly put your own spin on things. Either way, consider adding some flourishes to make your barbarian stand out from all others; see the following sections for some ideas.

entries.name: Personal Totems
entries: Barbarians tend to travel light, carrying little in the way of personal effects or other unnecessary gear. The few possessions they do carry often include small items that have special significance. A personal totem is significant because it has a mystical origin or is tied to an important moment in the character's life—perhaps a remembrance from the barbarian's past or a harbinger of what lies ahead.

A personal totem of this sort might be associated with a barbarian's spirit animal, or might actually be the totem object for the animal, but such a connection is not essential. One who has a bear totem spirit, for instance, could still carry an eagle's feather as a personal totem.
Consider creating one or more personal totems for your character—objects that hold a special link to your character's past or future. Think about how a totem might affect your character's actions.

entries.caption: Personal Totems
rows: A tuft of fur from a solitary wolf that you befriended during a hunt
Three eagle feathers given to you by a wise shaman, who told you they would play a role in determining your fate
A necklace made from the claws of a young cave bear that you slew singlehandedly as a child
A small leather pouch holding three stones that represent your ancestors
A few small bones from the first beast you killed, tied together with colored wool
An egg-sized stone in the shape of your spirit animal that appeared one day in your belt pouch

entries.name: Tattoos
entries: The members of many barbarian clans decorate their bodies with tattoos, each of which represents a significant moment in the life of the bearer or the bearer's ancestors, or which symbolizes a feeling or an attitude. As with personal totems, a barbarian's tattoos might or might not be related to an animal spirit.
Each tattoo a barbarian displays contributes to that individual's identity. If your character wears tattoos, what do they look like, and what do they represent?

entries.caption: Tattoos
rows: The wings of an eagle are spread wide across your upper back.
Etched on the backs of your hands are the paws of a cave bear.
The symbols of your clan are displayed in viny patterns along your arms.
The antlers of an elk are inked across your back.
Images of your spirit animal are tattooed along your weapon arm and hand.
The eyes of a wolf are marked on your back to help you see and ward off evil spirits.

entries.name: Superstitions
entries: Barbarians vary widely in how they understand life. Some follow gods and look for guidance from those deities in the cycles of nature and the animals they encounter. These barbarians believe that spirits inhabit the plants and animals of the world, and the barbarians look to them for omens and power.

Other barbarians trust only in the blood that runs in their veins and the steel they hold in their hands. They have no use for the invisible world, instead relying on their senses to hunt and survive like the wild beasts they emulate.
Both of these attitudes can give rise to superstitions. These beliefs are often passed down within a family or shared among the members of a clan or a hunting group.
If your barbarian character has any superstitions, were they ingrained in you by your family, or are they the result of personal experience?

entries.caption: Superstition
rows: If you disturb the bones of the dead, you inherit all the troubles that plagued them in life.
Never trust a wizard. They're all devils in disguise, especially the friendly ones.
Dwarves have lost their spirits, and are almost like the undead. That's why they live underground.
Magical things bring trouble. Never sleep with a magic object within ten feet of you.
When you walk through a graveyard, be sure to wear silver, or a ghost might jump into your body.
If an elf looks you in the eyes, she's trying to read your thoughts.

classFeature.name: 狂暴
entries: 在战斗中，你带着原初的狂怒作战。在你的回合，你能够以一个附赠动作进入狂暴。
当处于狂暴时，若你未穿戴重甲，你获得下列好处：

items: 你在力量检定和力量豁免中具有优势。
当你进行一次使用力量的近战武器攻击时，你在伤害骰上获得+2加值。这个加值会随着你的等级而增加。
你对钝击、穿刺、和挥砍伤害具有抗性。

entries: 若你能够施放法术，则你在狂暴期间无法施放它们或维持法术上的专注。
你的狂暴持续1分钟。它会在你被击倒{@condition 昏迷}时提前结束，或若你从上回合到这回合结束时都没有攻击一个敌意生物或受到伤害，则狂暴也将提前结束。你也可以在你的回合以一个附赠动作结束你的狂暴﹐
一旦你狂暴的次数达到你当前野蛮人等级所能狂暴的最大次数，你就必须要完成一次长休才能够再次狂暴。你在1级时可以狂暴二次，3级时三次，6级时四次，12级时五次，以及17级时六次。

classFeature.name: 无甲防御
entries: 当你未穿戴护甲时，你的AC等于10 + 你的敏捷调整值 + 你的体质调整值。你可以使用盾牌而仍获得这个好处。

classFeature.name: 险境感知
entries: 在2级时，你获得一种能查觉到周遭异状的超常感知能力，让你在躲避危险时掌握先机。你在对抗你所能见的效果时所进行的敏捷豁免中具有优势，像是陷阱和法术。要获得此好处，你不能处于{@condition 目盲}、{@condition 耳聋}或{@condition 无力}状态。

classFeature.name: 鲁莽攻击
entries: 从2级开始，你可以抛下防御以展开不顾一切的猛烈攻击。当你在你的回合进行你的第一次攻击时，你可以选择鲁莽地攻击。这么做会让你在该回合间所有使用力量的近战武器攻击检定具有优势，但直到你的下个回合，所有对你进行的攻击检定也将具有优势。

classFeature.name: Survival Instincts
entries: {@i 2nd-level barbarian feature (replaces Danger Sense)}
You become proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill 驯兽}, {@skill 医疗}, {@skill 自然}, {@skill 察觉}, or {@skill 生存}.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those skills.

classFeature.name: 原初见闻
entries: {@i 3级野蛮人 {@variantrule 可选职业特性|tce|可选特性}}
当你的野蛮人职业等级达到3级和10级时，你可以从野蛮人1级所提供的技能熟练项列表中选择一个技能，获得该技能的熟练。

classFeature.name: 原初道途
entries: 在3级时，你从可选道途列表中选择一种形塑你愤怒本质的道途。你的选择将在3级、6级、10级、和14级时赋予你新的能力。

classFeature.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至4级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能通过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 额外攻击
entries: 从5级开始，每当你在自己回合执行{@action 攻击}动作时，你可以发动两次攻击，而非一次。

classFeature.name: 快速移动
entries: 从5级开始，当你未穿戴重甲时，你的移动速度增加10尺。

classFeature.name: Instinctive Pounce
entries: {@i 5th-level barbarian feature (replaces Fast Movement)}
When a creature ends its turn within 15 feet of you, you can use your reaction to move up to half your speed to a space closer to the creature. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

classFeature.name: 道途能力
entries: 在6级时，你获得一个来自你原初道途的能力。

classFeature.name: 野性直觉
entries: 从7级起，你的直觉是如此犀利，你在先攻骰中具有优势。
此外，若你在战斗开始时被突袭且未陷入{@condition 无力}状态，则你可以在你的第一个回合中如常行动。若你这么做，你必须在该回合进行任何行动前进入狂暴。

classFeature.name: 直觉猛扑
entries: {@i 7级野蛮人 {@variantrule 可选职业特性|tce|可选特性}}
作为你进入狂暴的附赠动作的一部分，你可以移动最多等同于你移动速度一半的距离。

classFeature.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至8级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能通过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 凶蛮重击(1颗骰)
entries: 从9级开始，你可以在决定近战攻击的重击所造成的额外伤害时额外骰一颗武器伤害骰。
这个能力会在13级时增加至二颗额外的伤害骰，在17级时增加至三颗额外的伤害骰。

classFeature.name: 道途能力
entries: 在10级时，你获得一个来自你原初道途的能力。

classFeature.name: 顽强狂暴
entries: 从11级开始，你的狂暴让你即使身受重伤也可以持续战斗。若你在狂暴中生命值归零而没有立即死亡，则你可以进行一次DC 10的体质豁免。若豁免成功，则改为将你的生命值减少至1。
在你首次使用此能力后的每次，这个豁免检定的DC都会增加5。当你完成一次短休或长休后，这个豁免检定的DC将会重置为10。

classFeature.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至12级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能通过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 凶蛮重击(2颗骰)
entries: 在13级时，你可以在决定近战攻击的重击所造成的额外伤害时额外骰二颗武器伤害骰。
这个能力会在17级时增加至三颗额外的伤害骰。

classFeature.name: 道途能力
entries: 在14级时，你获得一个来自你原初道途的能力。

classFeature.name: 持久狂暴
entries: 从15级开始，你的狂暴是如此猛烈，以至于它只会在你陷入{@condition 昏迷}或你选择结束它时提早结束。

classFeature.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至16级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能通过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 16th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 凶蛮重击(3颗骰)
entries: 在17级时，你可以在决定近战攻击的重击所造成的额外伤害时额外骰三颗武器伤害骰。

classFeature.name: 不屈勇武
entries: 从18级开始，若你力量检定的总值低于你的力量值，则你可以使用该数值以取代该力量检定的总值。

classFeature.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至19级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能通过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 19th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: 原初勇士
entries: 在20级时，你本身的存在就体现了荒野的力量。你的力量和体质增加4点。你这些数值的上限现在变更为24。

subclassFeature.name: 狂战士道途
entries: 对某些野蛮人来说，狂暴是一种达到极致的方式—暴力的极致。狂战士道途是一条追求鲜血与无拘狂怒的道路。随着你进入狂战士的狂暴时，你将在战斗的混乱快感中颤栗，舍身忘怀自己的安危。

subclassFeature.name: 狂怒
entries: {@i 3级狂战士道途特性}
你可以在狂暴时进入狂怒。若你这么做，则在你狂暴期间，你可以在这之后的你的每个回合以一个附赠动作进行一次近战武器攻击。当你的狂暴结束时，你将承受一级的{@condition 力竭}状态。

subclassFeature.name: 无我狂暴
entries: {@i 6级狂战士道途特性}
你在狂暴期间不会被{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐惧}。若你在进入狂暴时已经被{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐惧}，则该效果将在狂暴期间被压制。

subclassFeature.name: 威慑之姿
entries: {@i 10级狂战士道途特性}

你可以使用你的动作以用你那可怖的姿态恐吓他人。当你这么做时，选择一个距离你30尺内且你所能看见的生物。若该生物可以看见或听见你，则它必须成功通过一次感知豁免（DC等同于8 + 你的熟练加值 + 你的魅力调整值），否则将被你{@condition 恐惧}直到你的下个回合结束。在后续的回合，你可以使用你的动作使这个效果对被{@condition 恐惧}生物的影响延长到你的下个回合结束。这个效果会在该生物离开你的视野，或离开你超过60尺距离时结束。
若该生物成功通过该豁免检定，则你在接下来的24小时内都不能再对该生物使用此能力。

subclassFeature.name: 复仇
entries: {@i 14级狂战士道途特性}
当你受到来自一个距离你５尺内生物的伤害时，你可以使用你的反应以对该生物进行一次近战武器攻击。

subclassFeature.name: 熊
entries: 当狂暴时，你对除了心灵伤害以外的所有伤害具有抗性。熊之精魂将使你坚韧无匹，无惧于任何打击。

subclassFeature.name: 鹰
entries: 当你狂暴且未穿着重甲时，其他生物对你所进行的借机攻击将具有劣势，且你可以在你的回合以一个附赠动作使用{@action 疾走}动作。鹰之精魂将使你成为能在战场中自由穿梭的猎杀者。

subclassFeature.name: 图腾勇士道途
entries: 图腾勇士的道途是一趟灵魂修炼的旅程，野蛮人将接受一种精魂野兽作为向导、保护者、和启发者。在战斗中，你的图腾精魂将超自然的力量灌输于你，为你的狂暴注入魔法力量。
大部分的野蛮人部落都将图腾动物视作氏族的一员，因此很少会有人同时拥有两种或以上的图腾精魂，尽管仍然存在这样的特例。

subclassFeature.name: 狼
entries: 当你狂暴时，你的盟友在对任何距离你5尺内且对你有敌意的生物所进行的近战攻击检定具有优势。狼之精魂将使你成为猎手中的领袖。

subclassFeature.name: 精魂寻访者
entries: {@i 3级图腾勇士道途特性}
你追求于与大自然调和知道，使你与动物创建了亲密的关系。你获得施放{@spell 野兽知觉}和{@spell 动物交谈术}法术的能力，但只能通过仪式施展，参见{@book 第十章|PHB|10|rituals}的描述。

subclassFeature.name: 图腾精魂
entries: {@i 3级图腾勇士道途特性}
当你选择此道途时，你选择一种图腾精魂并获得它的能力。你必须制造或获得一个象征图腾野兽的兽毛、翼羽、利爪、牙齿、或骨头的图腾物体—例如护身符或其他类似的饰品。根据你的选择，你也可以获得一些让人联想到你图腾精魂的细微身体特征。举例而言，若你拥有熊的图腾精魂，你可能会有着特别茂盛的毛发和厚实的肌肤。若你的图腾为鹰，则你的瞳孔可能变成明亮的黄色。
你的图腾动物可能会是一个与下列这些有关，但更适合你家乡的动物。举例来说，你可以选择隼鸟或鹫来代替鹰。

subclassFeature.name: 熊
entries: 你获得熊之力量。你的负载能力（包括最大负重和最大举重）变为两倍，且你在拖曳、推动、提举、或破坏物体时所进行的力量检定将具有优势。

subclassFeature.name: 鹰
entries: 你获得鹰之锐目。你可以毫无困难地看见最远1里的距离，甚至能辨别出最细微的细节，就如同在查看距离你不超过100尺的事物一样。此外，微光光照并不会使你的感知（{@skill 察觉}）检定承受劣势。

subclassFeature.name: 狼
entries: 你获得狼的狩猎敏锐。你能够以快速步速追踪其他生物，且你能够以正常步速隐匿移动。

subclassFeature.name: 兽之形
entries: {@i 6级图腾勇士道途特性}
你获得一个基于你所选图腾动物的魔法益处。你可以选择一个与你在3级时所选相同或不同的动物。

subclassFeature.name: 精魂行者
entries: {@i 10级图腾勇士道途特性}
你可以施放{@spell 问道自然}法术，但只能通过仪式施展。当你这么做时，你在图腾精魂或兽之形所选择的其中一种动物的灵体版本将会出现并传达你所寻求的信息。

subclassFeature.name: 熊
entries: 当你狂暴时，任何距离你5尺内且对你有敌意的生物，将在对你或其他拥有此能力生物以外的目标所进行的攻击检定中具有劣势。若一个敌人无法看见或听见你、或它不会被{@condition 恐惧}，则它将免疫于这个效果。

subclassFeature.name: 鹰
entries: 当狂暴时，你将具有等同于你步行速度的飞行速度。这个好处只会在短时间作用；若你在空中结束你的回合且没有其他东西让你维持浮空，则你将坠落。

subclassFeature.name: 狼
entries: 当你狂暴时，当你在你的回合以一次近战武器攻击命中一个体型为大型或更小的生物时，你可以使用一个附赠动作以将它击倒{@condition 伏地}。

subclassFeature.name: 图腾调律
entries: {@i 14级图腾勇士道途特性}
你获得一个基于你所选图腾动物的魔法益处。你可以选择一个与你先前所选相同或不同的动物。

subclassFeature.name: 战狂道途
entries: 在矮人语中以「库扎尔夫」闻名（意为「斧头笨蛋」），战狂是一群追随着战争之神，并选择了战狂道途的矮人们。他们特化于穿着笨重的{@item 钉刺甲|scag}投身战斗中，用他们的躯体本身打击敌人，让自己挥洒战斗的狂怒。

subclassFeature.name: 战狂护甲
entries: {@i 3级战狂道途特性}
你获得把{@item 钉刺甲|scag}作为武器使用的能力。
当你穿着{@item 钉刺甲|scag}并处于狂暴时，你可以使用一个附赠动作以你护甲上的尖刺对一个距离你5尺内的目标进行一次近战武器攻击。若该攻击命中，该尖刺将造成{@damage 1d4}穿刺伤害。你将力量调整值用于该攻击的攻击检定和伤害骰中。
此外，当你使用{@action 攻击}动作以{@action 擒抱}一个生物时，若你的擒抱检定成功，目标将受到3点穿刺伤害。

subclassFeature.name: 限制 - 仅限矮人
entries: {@i 3级战狂道途特性}
只有矮人可以追随战狂道途。战狂在矮人的社会和文化中占据了特殊的地位。
你的DM可以拔除这个限制以使之更符合战役设置。这个限制是为了被遗忘的国度而存在，但这也许并不适用于你DM的设定，或他那个版本的国度。

subclassFeature.name: 鲁莽放荡
entries: {@i 6级战狂道途特性}
当你在狂暴时使用鲁莽攻击，你也将获得等同于你体质调整值（最少为1）的临时生命值。若你在狂暴结束时有任何剩余的这些临时生命值，则它们将会消失。

subclassFeature.name: 战狂冲锋
entries: {@i 10级战狂道途特性}
当你处于狂暴时，你能够以一个附赠动作采取{@action 疾走}动作。

subclassFeature.name: 尖刺反击
entries: {@i 14级战狂道途特性}
当一个距离你5尺内的生物以一次近战攻击命中你时，若你处于狂暴，未陷入{@condition 无力}状态，且正穿着{@item 钉刺甲|scag}，则攻击者将受到3点穿刺伤害。

subclassFeature.name: 野兽道途
entries: 走上了野兽道途的野蛮人从他们灵魂中熊熊燃烧的野兽汲取怒火与力量。随着进入狂暴的阵痛，他们灵魂中的野兽爆发出来，让这些野蛮人的身体形态发生变化。
这样的野蛮人可能在身体里寄宿了一个原初精魂，或者是一个变形者的后代。你可以从以下的兽性之源列表中选择或者掷骰决定一个自己野兽能力的来源。

entries.caption: 兽性起源
rows: 你的双亲中有一位狼人，其诅咒顺着血脉延续到了你身上。
你是一个大德鲁伊的后裔，并且继承了一些局部的变形能力。
一个精类灵体赐予了你获得各种野兽体态的能力。
一个远古野兽的灵魂栖息在你体内，这让你走上了野兽的道途。

subclassFeature.name: 野兽之形
entries: {@i 3级野兽道途特性}
当你进入狂暴时，你可以变形，显现出你体内的野兽之力。直到你的狂暴结束，你获得一件天生武器。它对你视作简易近战武器。和普通的简易近战武器一样，你在你的攻击骰和伤害骰上加上你的力量调整值。
在你进入狂暴时，你可以在以下几种天生武器中选择一种：

items.name: 噬咬。
items.entry: 你的嘴变形成一个野兽的血盆大口或者巨大的昆虫大颚（由你选择）。它的一次攻击能造成{@damage 1d8}穿刺伤害。每回合一次，当你用它命中一个生物并造成伤害时，你回复等同于你的熟练等级的生命值。你只能在生命值低于一半的时候使用此方式回复生命值。

items.name: 利爪。
items.entry: 你的双手变成了一对利爪，当他没有持握东西时，可以把它当作作武器使用。利爪命中后能够造成{@damage 1d6}挥砍伤害。每回合一次，当你用利爪以{@action 攻击}动作进行攻击时，你可以额外攻击一次，作为同一个攻击动作的一部分。

items.name: 尾击。
items.entry: 你长出一条绳索一般的，多刺的长尾巴。它攻击命中能造成{@damage 1d8}的穿刺伤害，并且拥有触及属性。如果一个10尺以内的，你能看见的生物通过攻击检定的方式攻击并击中你，你可以消耗你的反应动作来挥舞你的尾巴进行挡避，你投一个{@dice d8}的骰子，并将它加入到你的AC中。这个反应可能可以让这次攻击转而无法命中你。

subclassFeature.name: 兽性之魂
entries: {@i 6级野兽道途特性}
你体内的野性力量不断增长，让你通过野兽之形获得的天生武器被视作魔法武器，以穿透对非魔法伤害的抗性或者免疫。
你也可以改变你身体的形态以更好的适应不同环境。每当你完成一次短休或者长休，你可以选择其中一项能力，你拥有该能力持续到你完成下一次短休或者长休：

items: 你获得与你行走速度相同的的游泳速度，并且可以在水下呼吸。
你获得与你行走速度相同的攀爬速度，你可以攀爬困难表面吗，包括倒挂在天花板上。你做这些攀爬时不需要进行检定。
当你跳跃时，你进行一次力量（{@skill 运动}）检定，并把该检定的数值加到你本次跳跃的极限距离上。你每回合只能用这个方式加强跳跃一次。

subclassFeature.name: 怒火侵蚀
entries: {@i 10级野兽道途特性}
当你在狂暴时用你的天生武器击中一个生物时，你内在的野兽可以诅咒你的目标变得如狂犬病似得病态癫狂。该生物需进行一次感知豁免（DC为8 + 你的熟练加值 + 你的体质调整值），如果失败，将必须承受以下的一种效果（由你决定）：

items: 目标必须消耗他的反应动作对你所选择的一个能看到的目标的进行一次近战攻击。

entries: 你可以使用该能力的次数等于你的熟练加值。每完成一次长休之后你恢复所有已消耗的使用次数。

subclassFeature.name: 狩猎呼唤
entries: {@i 14级野兽道途特性}
你内在的野兽已经成长的如此强大，你可以把你的其狂暴的战意散播到他人身上，并且这些加入你狩猎的人也会让你更加的强韧。当你进入狂暴时，你可以选择你可以看见的30尺以内的一定数量（等于你的体质调整值，至少为1）的其他自愿生物。
每个加入你狩猎的生物会给你5点临时生命值。直到你的狂暴终止前，加入你狩猎的生物每回合一次，进行攻击检定并造成伤害时，可以增加{@dice d6}的伤害骰。
你可以使用该能力的次数等于你的熟练加值。每完成一次长休之后你补充齐所有已消耗的使用次数。

subclassFeature.name: 狂野魔法道途
entries: 这个多元宇宙的许多地方充满了美丽，强烈的情感，以及狂野而难以控制的魔力。妖精荒野，上层位面，以及其他辐射着超自然力量的领域都以这股力量深深的影响着人们。我们情感丰富而激烈的老伙计们——野蛮人尤其容易受这些狂野的扰动影响。其中又一些人接受了狂野魔法的浸洗而转变，变形。这些被魔力染上一抹亮色的野蛮人所走的，便是狂野魔法道途。精类，提夫林，阿斯莫和元素裔的野蛮人中不乏选择狂野魔法道途的，希求显耀他们先祖的那不属于这个世界的魔力。

subclassFeature.name: 察觉魔法
entries: {@i 3级狂野魔法道途特性}
以一个动作，你让你的感官对聚集的魔力的存在保持警觉。知道你的下一个回合结束前，你可以知晓你60尺内任何法术或者魔法物品的位置，除非它们对你有全掩蔽。当你察觉到一个法术的存在时，你还能判断这个法术属于哪一个学派。
你可以使用该能力的次数等于你的熟练加值。每完成一次长休之后你恢复所有已消耗的使用次数。

subclassFeature.name: 狂野浪潮
entries: {@i 3级狂野魔法道途特性}
你体内那翻滚不息的魔法能量又是会从你身上爆发出来。当你进入狂暴状态时，掷骰子并根据以下"狂野魔法表"中决定所产生的狂野魔法。
如果这个狂野魔法需要进行豁免检定，则其DC等于8 + 你的熟练加值 + 你的体质调整值。

entries.caption: 狂野魔法
rows: 阴暗的卷须在你身边疯狂挥舞。在你能看到的30尺内，你选择若干生物，这些生物必须进行一次体质豁免，如果失败，则将受到{@damage 1d12}的黯蚀伤害。你获得{@dice 1d12}的临时生命值。
你可以传送到30尺内的一个未被占据的，你可以看到的地方。直到你的狂暴终止，你的每一个回合都可以消耗一个附赠动作再次发动这个效果。
一个无形的灵体，看起来像一个{@creature 呋噜}或者{@creature 皮克精}（由你决定），出现在一个你30尺内可以看到的生物的5尺以内。并且在当前回合结束时，这个灵体会爆炸，所有5尺以内的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免，如果失败，将承受{@damage 1d6}的力场伤害。直到你的狂暴结束前，你每个回合都可以消耗一次附赠动作来再次发动这个效果。
魔力与你所选择的一把你正持握着的武器相融在一起。直到你的狂暴结束前，这把武器的伤害类型转变为力场伤害，并且获得轻型和投掷（20尺/60尺）的属性。如果你手中不在持握有这把武器，它会在当前回合结束的时候重新出现在你的手中。
在你的狂暴结束前，每当一个生物以攻击检定的方式对你进行攻击并命中，你身上的魔力抽打反击对其造成{@damage 1d6}的力场伤害。
在你的狂暴结束前，你周身围绕着彩色的防护光芒。你的AC获得+1加值，并且在你10尺内的伙伴也可以享受到这一加成。
你身边暂时生长出花朵与藤蔓。在你的狂暴结束前，你周围15尺的地面对你的敌人视作困难地形。
一束光从你胸膛射出。你所选择的30尺内的你可以看到的一个其他生物必须进行一次体质豁免检定，如果失败，将会受到{@damage 1d6}的光耀伤害，并且直到你的下一个回合开始前，其将一直{@condition 目盲}。直到你的狂暴结束前，你每个回合都可以消耗一次附赠动作来再次发动这个效果。

subclassFeature.name: 振奋魔法
entries: {@i 6级狂野魔法道途特性}
你可以用你的狂野魔法并用于振奋自己或者一个同伴。以一个动作，你触碰一个生物（也可以是你自己）并且为该生物提供以下增益中你所选择的一种：

items: 持续10分钟，该生物在掷攻击骰或者属性检定时可以额外掷一个{@dice d3}的骰子，将其加到所掷的{@dice d20}中。
掷一次{@dice d3}。该生物将恢复一个法术位，其环数必须小于等于所掷出骰子的结果（由该生物决定）。当一个生物享受了这一增益后，直到下一次长休结束前都不能再次从此获益。

entries: 你可以使用该能力的次数等于你的熟练加值。每完成一次长休之后你恢复所有已消耗的使用次数。

subclassFeature.name: 无常反冲
entries: {@i 10级狂野魔法道途特性}
在你狂暴期间，如果你受到危险，你体内的魔法会猛烈爆发。每当你在狂暴时受到伤害或者没能通过豁免检定，你可以消耗一次反应动作再次触发狂野魔法浪涌，重新掷骰子并根据"狂野魔法表"立刻产生一次新的魔法效果。这个魔法效果将会替代你当前拥有的狂野魔法效果。

subclassFeature.name: 掌控浪潮
entries: {@i 14级狂野魔法道途特性}
每当你在"狂野魔法表"中掷骰决定狂野魔法效果时，你可以掷两次骰子并且选择其中之一作为所释放的狂野魔法效果。如果你掷出的两个骰子数值相同，那么你可以无视这个数字，任意选择一个"狂野魔法表"里的效果。

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Beast
entries: Barbarians who walk the Path of Beast draw their rage from a bestial spark burning within their souls. That beast howls to be released and bursts forth in the throes of rage.

Those who tread this path might be inhabited by a primal spirit or descended from shapeshifters. You can choose the origin of your feral might or determine it randomly by rolling on the Origin of the Beast table.

entries.caption: Origin of the Beast
rows: One of your parents is a lycanthrope, and you've inherited some of the curse.
You are descended from a legendary druid, a fact manifested by your ability to partially change shape.
A fey spirit gifted you with the ability to adopt different bestial aspects.
An ancient animal spirit dwells within you, allowing you to walk this path.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Beast
entries: {@i 3级野兽道途特性}

When you enter your rage, you can transform, revealing the bestial power within you. Until your rage ends, you manifest a natural melee weapon, choosing one of the following options each time you rage:

items.name: Bite
items.entry: Your mouth transforms into a bestial snout or great mandibles (your choice). Your bite deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with your bite, you regain a number of hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

items.name: Claws
items.entry: Your hands transform into claws, which deal {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit. When you take the {@action 攻击} action on your turn and make an attack with your claws, you can make one additional attack using your claws as part of the same action.

items.name: Tail
items.entry: You grow a lashing, spiny tail, which deals {@damage 1d12} piercing damage on a hit and has the reach property.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Soul
entries: {@i 6级野兽道途特性}

The feral spirit within you grows in power, causing the natural weapons of your Form of the Beast to count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

You can also call on the feral spirit to help you adapt to your surroundings. When you finish a short or long rest, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you finish a short or long rest:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
When you jump, you can make a Strength ({@skill 运动}) check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Fury
entries: {@i 10级野兽道途特性}

When you hit a creature with your natural weapons while you are raging, the spirit within you can curse your target with rabid fury. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or suffer one of the following effects (your choice):

items: The target must use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Hunt
entries: {@i 14级野兽道途特性}

The beast within grows so powerful that you can spread its ferocity to your allies. When you enter your rage, you can choose a number of willing creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one creature). Until your rage ends, the chosen creatures gain the Reckless {@action 攻击} feature and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition 恐惧}. You also gain 5 temporary hit points for each creature that accepts the benefit. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wild Soul
entries: The realm of the Feywild abounds with beauty, unpredictable emotion, and rampant magic. A barbarian exposed to this realm feels emotions powerfully and magic saturates their body.
When a barbarian who follows this path rages, it is a bellowing roar for freedom, an explosion of expression, manifesting in unpredictable ways.

subclassFeature.name: Lingering Magic
entries: At 3rd level, your body reacts to the presence of magic. You can cast the {@spell 侦测魔法} spell without using a spell slot or components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell. You faintly glow a color corresponding to the school of magic you detect (you choose the colors).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Surge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, magic erupts from you as you rage. When you enter your rage, roll on the Wild Surge table to determine the magical effect produced.
If the wild surge requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

entries.caption: Wild Surge
rows: Necrotic energy bursts from you. Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt to the creatures.
You teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your rage ends, you can activate this effect again on each of your turns as a bonus action.

You conjure {@dice 1d4} intangible spirits that look like {@creature flumph||flumphs} in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of you. Each spirit immediately flies 30 feet in a random direction. At the end of your turn, all spirits explode and each creature within 5 feet of one or more of them must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} force damage.

Arcane energy enshrouds you. Until your rage ends, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, that creature takes force damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
Plant life temporarily grows around you: until your rage ends, the ground within 10 feet of you is difficult terrain.

Arcane energy taps into the minds of those around you. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or you see a glimpse of the creature's thoughts, learning how it plans to attack you. As a result, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

Shadows weave around a weapon of your choice you are holding. Until your rage ends, your weapon deals psychic damage instead of its bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, and it gains the light and thrown properties with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If you drop the weapon or throw it, the weapon dissipates and reappears in your hand at the end of your turn.

A beam of brilliant light lances from your chest in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and be {@condition 目盲} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Reserves
entries: At 6th level, you can channel the magic surging inside you into other creatures. As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a {@dice d4}. The creature recovers an expended spell slot of a level equal to the number rolled. If the creature you touch can't recover a spell slot of that level, the creature instead gains temporary hit points equal to five times the number rolled.
You take force damage equal to five times the number rolled.
When you reach 14th level in this class, you increase the die to a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Rebuke
entries: At 10th level, the magic crackling within your soul lashes out. When a creature forces you to make a saving throw while you are raging, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 3d6} force damage to that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Chaotic Fury
entries: At 14th level, you become a wellspring of wild magic while you are raging. As a bonus action, you can reroll on the Wild Surge table, replacing your current effect with the new one.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Magic Reserves
entries: At 14th level, you increase your magic reserves die to a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger on in the world as mighty spirits who can guide and protect the living. When barbarians who follow this path rage, they cross the barrier into the spirit world and call on these guardian spirits for aid.
Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians fight to protect their tribes and their allies. With the spirits' help, they can hinder their foes even as they strike powerful blows against them.

In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell epic sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, spectral warriors appear when you rage. These warriors distract a foe you designate and hinder its attempts to evade you. While you're raging, you can use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn or until your rage ends, the chosen creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you, and if the creature takes the {@action 撤离} action within 5 feet of you, its speed is halved until the end of its turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Shield
entries: Beginning at 6th level, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide protection for your allies. If you are raging and an ally you can see within 30 feet of you takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to transfer your resistance to those damage types to the ally. The resistance applies to the incoming damage. Until the start of your next turn, the ally keeps the resistance and you lack it, unless you also have it from a source other than rage.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. Right before you make an Intelligence or a Wisdom check, you can give yourself advantage on the check. You can use this feature three times, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: At 14th level, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to strike your foes. When you or an ally you can see within 30 feet of you is damaged by a melee attack while you're raging, you can use your reaction to cause the attacker to take {@damage 2d8} force damage from the spirits.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: Typical barbarians harbor a fury that dwells within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn instead to transform their rage into a mantle of primal magic that swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into nature to create powerful, magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect the natural realm. Other storm heralds hone their craft in elite lodges founded in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Fury
entries: When you select this path at 3rd level, choose one of the following options: desert, sea, or tundra. The environment you choose shapes the nature of the storm you conjure when you rage. While raging, you emanate an aura in a 10-foot radius. The effects of this aura depend on your chosen environment.

entries.name: Desert
entries: Any enemy that ends its turn in your aura takes fire damage equal to 2 + your barbarian level divided by 4.

entries.name: Sea
entries: At the end of each of your turns, you can choose a creature in your aura other than yourself. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. The target takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 10th level and to {@dice 4d6} at 15th level.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: Any enemy that ends its turn in your aura takes cold damage equal to 2 + your barbarian level divided by 4.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: At 6th level, your link to the power of the storm grants you additional abilities based on the environment you chose at 3rd level.

entries.name: Desert
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage and don't suffer the effects of extreme heat.

entries.name: Sea
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage and can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: Tundra. You gain resistance to cold damage and don't suffer the effects of extreme cold.

subclassFeature.name: Shield of the Storm
entries: At 10th level, you learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect your allies. While you are raging, allies within your aura gain the benefits of your Storm Soul feature.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Storm
entries: At 14th level, the power of the storm you channel grows mightier.

entries.name: Desert
entries: The ground around you becomes like shifting sand. Any enemy that attempts to move more than 5 feet per turn on the ground while in your aura must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature's speed drops to 0 until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Sea
entries: Roaring winds tear through the area around you. Any creature in your aura that you hit with an attack must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition 伏地}.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: The air around you coldly slows your foes. The area within your aura is difficult terrain for your enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Zealot
entries: Some deities inspire their followers to pitch themselves into a ferocious battle fury. These barbarians are zealots—warriors who channel their rage into powerful displays of divine power.

A variety of gods across the worlds of D&D inspire their followers to embrace this path. Tempus from the Forgotten Realms and Hextor and Erythnul of Greyhawk are all prime examples. In general, the gods who inspire zealots are deities of combat, destruction, and violence. Not all are evil, but few are good.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Fury
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you can channel divine fury when you start to rage. If you do so, you become cloaked in an aura of divine power until the rage ends. At the end of each of your turns for that duration, each creature within 5 feet of you takes damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your barbarian level. The damage is necrotic or radiant; you choose the type of damage when you gain this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Gods
entries: At 3rd level, your soul is marked for endless battle. If a spell would have the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster does not need material components to cast the spell on you.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Focus
entries: At 6th level, the divine power that fuels your rage can shield you from harm. If you fail a saving throw while raging, you can instead succeed on that saving throw as a reaction. However, doing so immediately ends your rage, and you can't rage again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Presence
entries: At 10th level, you learn to channel divine power to inspire zealotry in others. As an action, you howl in fury and unleash a battle cry infused with divine energy. Every ally within 60 feet of you gains advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rage Beyond Death
entries: Beginning at 14th level, the divine power that fuels your rage allows you to shrug off fatal blows.

While raging, having 0 hit points doesn't knock you {@condition 昏迷}. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until your rage ends.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian v2
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger on in the world as mighty spirits who can guide and protect the living. When barbarians who follow this path rage, they cross the barrier into the spirit world and call on these guardian spirits for aid.
Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians fight to protect their tribes and their allies. With the spirits' help, they can hinder their foes even as they strike powerful blows against them.

In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell epic sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, spectral warriors appear when you rage. These warriors distract a foe you designate and hinder its attempts to evade you. While you're raging, the first creature you hit with an attack on your turn becomes the target of these warriors. Until the start of your next turn or until your rage ends, that target has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you, and creatures other than you have resistance to the damage of the creature's attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Shield
entries: Beginning at 6th level, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide protection for your allies. If you are raging and a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction and reduce that damage by {@dice 2d8}. When you reach certain levels in this class, you can reduce the damage by more: by {@dice 3d8} at 10th level and by {@dice 4d8} at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits and use them to scout far-off lands. When you do so, you cast the {@spell 锐眼术} spell, without needing a spell slot. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, the spell invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for the spell. After you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: At 14th level, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to strike foes that dare harm those that you protect. When you use your Spirit Shield Ability to protect a creature damaged by an attack, the attacker takes the same amount of damage that the Spirit Shield protects.

subclassFeature.name: 先祖守卫道途
entries: 有些野蛮人来自有着崇敬祖先文化的部落。这些部落教导着，过往的战士们将作为强大的精魂徘徊于世，引导并保护着活着的人们。当一个追随这条道途的野蛮人进入狂暴，他将连系上精魂灵界，并呼求这些守卫精魂的协助。
那些借用他们先祖守卫的野蛮人们能够更好地奋战以守卫他们的部落和盟友。为了牢固他们与先祖守卫的联系，追随这条道途的野蛮人会以歌颂他们先祖事迹的精巧纹身覆盖他们的身体。这些纹身描述着他们对抗可怕怪物其他可怖敌人的传奇胜利。

subclassFeature.name: 先祖守护
entries: {@i 3级先祖守卫道途特性}
灵体勇士将在你进入狂暴时出现。当你狂暴时，你在你回合以一次攻击命中的第一个生物将成为这些勇士的目标，这些勇士将阻碍该生物的攻击。直到你的下个回合开始前，目标在任何对你以外的目标所进行的攻击检定中具有劣势，且当目标以一次攻击命中一个你以外的生物，该生物将对该攻击所造成的伤害具有抗性。这个效果对目标的影响将在你结束狂暴时提早结束。

subclassFeature.name: 精魂之盾
entries: {@i 6级先祖守卫道途特性}
援助你的守卫精魂可以为那些你所守护的人们提供超自然防护。若你在狂暴中且另一个距离你30尺内且你所能看见的生物受到伤害，你可以使用你的反应以将该伤害减少{@dice 2d6}。
当你在此职业升至特定等级时，你可以减少更多的伤害：10级时改为减少{@dice 3d6}，以及14级时{@dice 4d6}。

subclassFeature.name: 问道精魂
entries: {@i 10级先祖守卫道途特性}
你获得与你先祖精魂交流的能力。当你这么做时，你可以施放{@spell 卜筮}或{@spell 锐眼术}法术，而无需使用法术位或材料构材。通过这个方式使用{@spell 锐眼术}并不会创造出灵体感应器，而是在所选区域召唤出你的其中一个先祖精魂。你施展这些法术的施法属性为感知。
当你通过这个方式施放其中任意一个法术，直到你完成一次短休或长休之前你都不能再使用此能力。

subclassFeature.name: 复仇先祖
entries: {@i 14级先祖守卫道途特性}
你的先祖精魂变得强大到足以反击敌人。当你使用你的精魂之盾能力以减少一次攻击的伤害时，攻击者将受到与你精魂之盾所减少的伤害相同数值的力场伤害。

subclassFeature.name: 风暴先驱道途
entries: 所有野蛮人的体内都怀着狂怒。他们的狂暴将赋予他们卓越的力量、耐力、以及速度。追随着风暴先驱道途的野蛮人们学会将这狂暴转变成环绕在他们周遭的原初魔法。当处于这种狂怒中，这个道途的野蛮人将发掘出大自然的力量以创造强大的魔法效果。
风暴先驱通常是那些和德鲁伊、游侠、和其他誓言守护自然之人一同锻炼的菁英勇士。而其他风暴先驱则会暂居风暴肆虐之地以磨练他们的技艺，例如世界尽头的极寒地带，或最酷热沙漠的深处。

subclassFeature.name: 风暴灵光
entries: {@i 3级风暴先驱道途特性}
你将在处于狂暴时散发出一道风暴般的魔法灵光。这道灵光将从你身上向全方位延伸10尺，但并无法穿透全掩护。
你的灵光具有一个会在你进入狂暴时被激发的效果，且你可以在你的每个回合以一个附赠动作再次激发这个效果。从沙漠、海洋、和冻原中选择一种环境。你的灵光效果将根据你所选的环境而有所不同，详述如下。每当你提升此职业的等级，你都可以变更你所选择的环境。
若你的灵光效果要求一次豁免检定，则DC等同于8 + 你的熟练加值 + 你的体质调整值。

subclassFeature.name: 风暴之魂
entries: {@i 6级风暴先驱道途特性}
即使你的灵光并未启动，风暴仍将赐予你好处。这个能力的好处将根据你在风暴灵光中所选的环境而有所不同。

subclassFeature.name: 护盾风暴
entries: {@i 10级风暴先驱道途特性}
你学会如何运用你对风暴的掌控以保护他人。当每个你所选择的生物处于你的风暴灵光中时，该生物将获得你在风暴之魂能力中所获得的伤害抗性。

subclassFeature.name: 狂怒风暴
entries: {@i 14级风暴先驱道途特性}
你所引导的暴风力量变得更加强大，袭向你的敌人们。这个能力的效果将根据你在风暴灵光中所选的环境而有所不同。

subclassFeature.name: 狂热者道途
entries: 某些神祇激励他们的追随者投身于残酷的战斗狂怒中。这些野蛮人被称作狂热者—他们是一群将自己的狂暴引导转变为强大神性力量的战士们。
在D&D的众多世界中，有许多神祇都会鼓励自己的追随者拥抱狂热者道途。最著名的几个例子包括费伦世界的{@deity 坦帕斯}、以及灰鹰世界的{@deity 海克斯托|greyhawk}和{@deity 厄瑞斯努|greyhawk}。一般来说，这些煽动狂热者的神祇往往掌有战斗、破坏、和暴力相关的神职。他们并不全都是邪恶的，但很少是善良的。

subclassFeature.name: 神性狂怒
entries: {@i 3级狂热者道途特性}
你可以引导神性狂怒注入你的武器打击中。当你处于狂暴时，你在你的每个回合以武器攻击命中的第一个生物将受到等同于{@dice 1d6} + 你野蛮人等级的一半的额外伤害。这个额外伤害的伤害类型为黯蚀或光耀；你在获得此能力时选择其中一个伤害类型。

subclassFeature.name: 诸神勇士
entries: {@i 3级狂热者道途特性}
你的灵魂被印记于加入无尽的战斗。若一个法术，像是{@spell 唤醒死者}，只具有能将你从死里复活的效果（但不能是作为不死生物复活），则施法者在对你施放该法术时并不需要材料构材。

subclassFeature.name: 狂热专注
entries: {@i 6级狂热者道途特性}
那驱使你狂暴的神性力量将能够保护你。若你在狂暴时于一次豁免检定中失败，你可以重骰该豁免检定，且你必须使用新的掷骰结果。你只能在每次狂暴使用此能力一次。

subclassFeature.name: 狂热之姿
entries: {@i 10级狂热者道途特性}
你学会如何引导神性力量以激发他人心中的狂热。以一个附赠动作，你释放出一阵充满神性能量的战吼。你选择最多十个距离你60尺内且能听见你的其他生物，直到你的下个回合开始前，他们在攻击检定和豁免检定中具有优势。
一旦你使用此能力，直到你完成一次长休之前你都不能再使用它。

subclassFeature.name: 怒不畏死
entries: {@i 14级狂热者道途特性}
那驱使你狂暴的神性力量将让你得以无视最致命的打击。
当你狂暴时，生命值被归零并不会将你击倒{@condition 昏迷}。你仍然必须进行死亡豁免，你在生命值为零的情况下受到伤害时仍会承受正常的效果。然而，若你因为死亡豁免失败而将要死亡，则你直到狂暴结束前都不会死亡，且你只有在那个时候生命值仍然为零时才会死亡。

subclassFeature.name: 鹿
entries: 当你狂暴且未穿着重甲时，你的步行速度增加15尺。鹿之精魂将使你格外迅捷。

subclassFeature.name: 虎
entries: 当狂暴时，你可以使你的跳远距离增加10尺，并使你的跳高距离增加3尺。虎之精魂将强化你的跳跃能力。

subclassFeature.name: 鹿
entries: 无论是骑乘或徒步，你的旅行步调将变为二倍。只要你未处于{@condition 无力}状态，则最多十个距离你60尺内的同伴的旅行步调也将变为二倍。鹿之精魂将帮助你行得更快更远。

subclassFeature.name: 虎
entries: 你获得下列其中二个技能的熟练：{@skill 运动}、{@skill 体操}、{@skill 隐匿}、和{@skill 生存}。猫科精魂将磨练你的生存本能。

subclassFeature.name: 鹿
entries: 当狂暴时，你可以在你的移动期间使用一个附赠动作，以穿过一个体型为大型或更小的生物所占据的空间。该生物必须成功通过一次力量豁免（DC为8 + 你的力量调整值 + 你的熟练加值），否则被击倒{@condition 伏地}，并受到等同于{@dice 1d12} + 你的力量调整值的钝击伤害。

subclassFeature.name: 虎
entries: 当你狂暴时，若你向一个体型为大型或更小的生物直线移动至少20尺并接着立即对它进行一次近战武器攻击，则你可以使用一个附赠动作以对它进行一次额外的近战武器攻击。

subclassFeature.name: 沙漠
entries: 当这个效果被激发时，所有其他处于你灵光中的生物都将各自受到2点火焰伤害。这个伤害将在你本职业升至特定等级时增加，5级时增加至3点，10级时4点，15级时5点，和20级时6点。

subclassFeature.name: 海洋
entries: 当这个效果被激发时，你可以选择处于你灵光中一个你所能看见的其他生物。目标必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败的目标将受到{@dice 1d6}闪电伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半的伤害。这个伤害将在你本职业升至特定等级时增加，10级时增加至{@dice 2d6}，15级时{@dice 3d6}，和20级时{@dice 4d6}。

subclassFeature.name: 冻原
entries: 当这个效果被激发时，由于冷冻惊魂将使人适应于苦难，每个处于你灵光中你所选择的生物将获得2点临时生命值。这个临时生命值将在你本职业升至特定等级时增加，5级时增加至3点，10级时4点，15级时5点，和20级时6点。

subclassFeature.name: 沙漠
entries: 你获得对火焰伤害的抗性，且你不会受到极端高温环境的影响（参见地下城主指南的描述）。此外，以一个动作，你可以触碰一个未被其他人穿戴或携带的可燃物体，并使之起火燃烧。

subclassFeature.name: 海洋
entries: 你获得对闪电伤害的抗性，且你可以在水下呼吸。你也获得30尺的游泳速度。

subclassFeature.name: 冻原
entries: 你获得对冷冻伤害的抗性，且你不会受到极端寒冷环境的影响（参见地下城主指南的描述）。此外，以一个动作，你可以触碰水并将其中5尺边长立方体的区域转变成冰，这块冰将在1分钟之后融化。若有生物在这个立方体区域内，则这个动作将失败。

subclassFeature.name: 沙漠
entries: 紧接在一个处于你灵光中生物以一次攻击命中你之后，你可以使用你的反应以强迫该生物进行一次敏捷豁免。若豁免失败，该生物将受到等同于你野蛮人等级一半的火焰伤害。

subclassFeature.name: 海洋
entries: 当你以一次攻击命中一个处于你灵光中的生物，你可以使用你的反应以强迫该生物进行一次力量豁免。若豁免失败，该生物将被击倒{@condition 伏地}，就好像被海浪冲倒。

subclassFeature.name: 冻原
entries: 每当你风暴灵光的效果被启动，你可以选择一个灵光中你所能看见的生物。该生物必须成功通过一次力量豁免，否则随着他被魔法寒霜给覆盖，他的移动速度将被归零直到你的下个回合开始。
